problem.p:
A simple random sample of 100 ights for United Airlines and a simple random sample of 100 ights for American Airlines was obtained. Let \(p_1\) be the true proportion of all
ights that are on time for United Airlines and let \(p_2\) be the true proportion of all ights
that are on time for American Airlines. Let \(\hat{p_1}\) and \(\hat{p_2}\) be the sample proportions of on time ights for United
Airlines and American Airlines, respectively. Based on the sample proportions, the 90% condence interval for
the difference in the on-time rates for the two airlines, \(p_1 p_2\), was calculated to be
(0.259, 0.055).
---
Based on the 90% condence interval given above, answer each of
the following questions with _true_, _false_, or _can't tell_.
1. The true difference in the on-time rate for the two airlines lies in the
90% condence interval (0.259, 0.055).

2. The probability that \(\hat{p_1} \hat{p_2}\) lies in
the 90% condence interval (0.259, 0.055) is 1.

3. The probability that the true difference in the on-time rate for the two
airlines lies in the 90% condence interval (0.259, 0.055) is equal to 0.90.

p.b: In this question, try to carefully identify which quantities are deterministic, and which are random.
